@theGBDOC #gbdoc Fancy a luxury post- Christmas / 2017 retreat?! Discounts for #DOC https://t.co/nbuh13U1ff https://t.co/SlMNjPwWhV
@happywombelle @parthaskar sorry to her that
@parthaskar @happywombelle accept that, yes DSN and diabetes cover not the same.
@happywombelle @parthaskar It is true in Edinburgh, rota (both consultant and junior) exactly the same as midweek for the admissions unit.
@parthaskar Medical staffing same at weekends in AMU and EDs, it's social, AHP, pharmacy etc that needs funding. Never been about doctors.
@Fractis @AdrianLong3 cats and diabetes eh?!
@AdrianLong3 Thanks Adrian. We thought we were over cats until we met these and now we are smitten!!!
@bad_diabetic @type1project @Tims_Pants @parthaskar @DiabetesUK I understand, but sometimes a change can be transformational too?
@AdrianLong3 One of our new friends, arrived yesterday settled already! https://t.co/Ue7QaaAmxw
@type1project @Tims_Pants @parthaskar @DiabetesUK But there are things we can do to promote high standards of competence in education / tech
@type1project @Tims_Pants @parthaskar @DiabetesUK Some of our patients request specific registrars at clinic so it's quite person-specific
@Tims_Pants @type1project @parthaskar @DiabetesUK Registrars will be our D specialists of the future so they need to learn from you!
@theGBDOC Wishing 2017 will being the need (funding) for a "CGM trace" bingo instead of BG!
@theGBDOC Hello, lurker here, Anna diabetes doc - have learnt huge amounts from joining @theGBDOC in 2016.

@zonaljoe @DiscomDiabetic DAFNE suggests before bed and on waking to give an overlap for dawn â¬†ï¸. Levemir might be better if splitting dose?
@drfrasergibb If only. Another sad day.
@bad_diabetic @andrew_x I think your dive buddy needs to know...
@OceanTragic @andrew_x I'll need lots of bags. May never come back!
@OceanTragic @andrew_x Libres underwater at the Great Barrier Reef - now that could tempt me back in to academic medicine!
@andrew_x @OceanTragic I'm definitely no expert btw! Heard Peter Adolfsson speak last year at Scottish SSG meeting - he's quite expert!
@andrew_x @OceanTragic ...may be why they wanted a "healthy" (not at risk of hypo) control? 2/2
@andrew_x @OceanTragic agreed but I think it was also to provide data supporting safety recommendations for diving with T1... 1/2
@OceanTragic @andrew_x Don't think so...would need to scrutinise study...
@OceanTragic @andrew_x Yes, they wore it during the dives.
@andrew_x Peter Adolfsson is the man behind diasend I think btw!
@andrew_x Think it was to evaluate safety of diving with T1 not just evaluating the CGM, thus needed comparison with people without T1?
This of interest? @andrew_x @OceanTragic Glucose Monitoring & Type 1 Diabetes during Recreational diving https://t.co/sozGpdIzPK
I love Scotland in the snow! https://t.co/E6udvom6qw
